Release.definition: to relieve or free from obligation
Release.origin: [the debtor is released from all dischargeable debts]

1 a.definition: discharge from an obligation or responsibility that bars a cause of action [did not effect a of the school for any negligence]

sub_terms.b: the giving up or renunciation of a right or claim that bars a cause of action [was a of the remainder of the debt]

1 a.note: A release may in some situations require consideration in order to be valid. A release of one joint obligor sometimes is considered to release all the obligors.

2.definition: an act or instrument that effects a release [signed a issued by the insurer] called alsocompare

3.definition: the act or instance of freeing esp. from custody
